title: Taylor Swift serenades fans as she teases intimate acoustic NPR Tiny Desk concert on Instagram
text:
Taylor Swift is one of the world's biggest stars.

But lucky fans got a chance to see the Lover songstress in a very intimate setting when the singer/songwriter perform one of NPR's Tiny Desk Concerts.

Taylor teased the radio show's release on Instagram Friday, writing: 'Tiny desk, BIG mood' along with a number of shots from the exclusive acoustic set.

Small wonder: Taylor Swift teased the release of an intimate NPR Tiny Desk concert on her social media Friday

Swift went on to thank NPR, writing: 'Thank you @npr for that awesome experience, I can’t wait to relive it when #tinydesk comes out!'

Taylor looked low key in the photos, wearing a burgundy velvet top an plaid pants as she sat down with an acoustic guitar.

Another photo showed the performer surrounded by a room of admiring fans intermixed with NPR employees.

A T. Swift fan account shared a set list from the performance, revealing she sang Lover and All Too Well accompanied by piano and also played The Man and Death By A Thousand Cuts on guitar.

Understated: Taylor looked low key in the photos, wearing a burgundy velvet top an plaid pants as she sat down with an acoustic guitar

Gather round! Another photo showed the performer surrounded by a room of admiring fans intermixed with NPR employees

While Taylor focused on her craft this week, longtime rival Justin Bieber spent time trolling the singer with a parody video reenacting Swift's viral post-surgery video where she had a mini melt down over a banana

Monday on Instagram Live Bieber seemed to mock the singer as he stood in his large designer kitchen and shouted: 'It's not the banana I wanted! It's not the right banana. It has no head.'

Hailey stood behind the camera and assured her main man that the content 'was so funny' as he paraded around the room.

Jokes! On Instagram Live yesterday, he stood in his large designer kitchen and shouted: 'It's not the banana I wanted! It's not the right banana. It has no head'

The video didn't go down as well with Swift's fans - coming as it did, just three months after Swift accused Bieber of bullying.

Early Monday morning Hailey took to Twitter to defend her husband from Swift's outraged fans.

Sharing a video of a distressed Swift fan, Hailey wrote: 'I never knew I could make somebody so upset... truly I'm so sorry you're THIS upset?! Lord have mercy I hope I'm never this upset about someone I don't know!!'

Striking a more conciliatory tone, she then wrote: 'Listen. I think it's awesome how passionate you are and how hard you ride for someone you're a fan of, it's beautiful how dedicated you are.

Whoops! Early Monday morning Hailey took to Twitter to defend her husband from Swift's outraged fans

Talk about it: Hailey was impressed by the 'passionate' pleas and admitted she never meant to 'hurt or offend'

'If there's something I did to personally hurt you or offend you I'm sorry, it's not my intention to upset you by any means. but being angry at someone you don't know does nothing for you. I know cause I been there. All it's gonna do is make you miserable. Don't let ME of all people get you feeling that way. Trust me, I'm not worth the energy, nobody should be worth that energy!'

Taylor's video screened last Thursday during her guest appearance on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon.

Unbeknownst to Swift, 29, her mother, Andrea, shared the hilarious video of the singer after her recent LASIK eye surgery.

In the clip, a medicated Swift can be seen fumbling with a bunch of bananas while wearing a brown puppy face sweater and a protective plastic shield over her eyes.

The clip showed Taylor getting upset as she tried to take a piece of fruit for a snack while her mother warned her not to cry.
description: 'Tiny desk, BIG mood' the star captioned a collection of shots from the exclusive acoustic set. Taylor looked laid back in a velvet shirt and plaid trousers as she sat down with an guitar to serenade the small crowd.
